review_title: Know what you are worth in the for-profit world

cons: Very low compensation average across departments. Only directors and up can really afford to have families and maintain a growth oriented personal budget unless they have multiple streams of income.

review_title: Happy and holy place to work
job_title: Business Development Associate in Pittsburgh, PA
pros: I felt very uplifted and encouraged by my management.
cons: I don't think I got paid enough.

pros: Great environment, Jesus-centered, faith-focused, dynamic range of jobs
cons: Low pay at times, but overall not too many complaints

pros: Excellent Culture, supportive colleagues, great benefits for Families and Dependents, great matching program for retirement.
cons: Salaries tend to be under-market, the peer schools are not a fair comparison for benefits.

pros: The faith life at Franciscan University is incredible - it is a wonderful place to work and be surrounded by people who are friendly, easy-going, and genuinely care about you. It's also great to be a part of something that transforms so many young lives! I strongly feel that everyone at the university is motivated about its cause, which is to bring the students that the university educates closer to God. In doing this, all of the students at the school become like a family, and I believe that the same is true of the faculty and staff... so in the end, I believe that if you can do what you want to do at a place like Franciscan University, then the people there will make all the difference in the world, and you just may find yourself excited about getting up to go to work in the morning!
cons: The pay can be generally lower than similar jobs at other universities or institutions, but the difference can be made up by living in the area around the university, which has a very low cost of living. Steubenville (though a little run-down) is a nice city, and has many very nice surrounding villages and towns that would make a great place to settle down with a family.

review_title: Lack of communication, unqualified upper level management, & poor hiring practices with excellent benefits
pros: Excellent benefit package including wellness programs, tuition remission, and opportunities to volunteer.  Events for all staff, encouraging staff interactions among departments, friendly co-workers.  Dynamic Catholic atmosphere.
cons: Poor upper level management.  Non-existent departmental communication.  Frequently hires people who are not qualified for the position in which they were hired (having little or no direct experience in the field or position).  Hold on to employees who are not productive or problematic and sacrifice good employees because of this.  Does not promote from within or make any effort to retain good employees.  High turn over because the aforementioned points.  Lack of employee support and training. Few women in upper management positions.

review_title: Great School for Theology and for receiving an education enlightened by the Faith
pros: Tuition remission, flexibility, very dedicated people in almost all positions.  Most employees love the University and identify with its mission.
cons: When the employee does not identifiy with the University and its vibrant students and faculty it creates a tense atmosphere at times.  Some of the employees see it as a good place to work in a financially depressed area and want to hold onto their jobs even if they don't care much for what goes on there.  That is understandable, but it always helps when someone loves what they are doing and really likes who they are serving.  Its a very small minority, but if that minority moved onto something else it would benefit both parties.

review_title: Okay if you don't want much money or responsibility....
pros: I guess probably the best thing about the job are the benefits.  Health benefits for now are pretty darn good although we'll see how long that lasts.  The people are pretty good to work with, although most are not motivated.  Young employees are usually out within a couple of years and there is not much of a bridge between them and the older employees and thus not much knowledge shared.  Hours are pretty good too.
cons: The pay for a university is always not the best, especially if it's a private school.  Steubenville is no exception.  The city itself is also just a junk town.

review_title: Love the school and the people, the area is not doing so well financially.
pros: The people are so nice and great to work with!
cons: Funding cuts mainly effected my department (the library). The school's financial plan seems a bit short-sighted, so it may be difficult to get a full-time long-term job there now.

review_title: A strong Catholic atmosphere, but with management problems.
pros: Strong Catholic atmosphere, take good care of employees. The new president, Fr. Sean O. Sheridan, is a strong leader. He's taking the University in a good direction.
cons: Management has difficulty letting go of employees who don't do their job. Hopefully the new president will change this culture and help the University move forward.

pros: This job at the front desk was excellent for developing a sense of professionalism, as well as familiarizing oneself with some of the basic vicissitudes of an office setting.
cons: Some co-workers were late (some chronically so), meaning that my replacement did not show up on time, I could not leave on time.  But this problem more or less passes with the changes in personnel over time.

pros: They provide you with the tools to succeed. Basically a work your own hours and log them, which puts a lot of trust in you. Had awesome tools with full adobe suite and a nice mac. Worked perfectly with being a full-time student.
cons: Working with other students mean we don't have a person to fully manage us.

pros: Impossible to get fired from
cons:
Lots of Nepotism 

Poor Communication Skills in management 

Unrealistic deadlines with the management having no real idea how video production works and no desire to learn how to

Boss never came to work and would never respond to messages about the direction the project was going in 

Terrible outdated and broken equipment/software

They forgot to process my pay, resulting in missing a paycheck for a month. This happened 3 times.

pros: Working at the Switchboard for FUS was a great opportunity. We were able work around our school schedules, work with friends, and able to work on homework and study as long as we were able to answer phones and help people coming to the desk first.
cons: Not many. Great college job!
